at.ac.tuwien.policenauts.l4.game

Class TextureManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.tuwien.policenauts.l4.game.TextureManager

  • class TextureManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Load and store textures for reuse accross objects.
    Author:
    Michael Pucher

    • Method Detail

      • setCanvas

        void setCanvas(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Assign a canvas to the texture manager for drawing.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas to be assigned (needs to be locked by calling thread)

      • loadTextures

        boolean loadTextures(java.util.List<java.lang.String> sprites,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> spriteFrameCount,
                     java.util.List<java.lang.String> textureList)
        Load a list of sprites and a list of textures from the resources.
        Parameters:
        sprites - A list of sprite resource names
        spriteFrameCount - A list containing the number of frames for each sprite
        textureList - A list of texture resource names
        Returns:
        True if everything loaded successfully, False otherwise

      • drawSprite

        void drawSprite(Sprite sprite,
                android.graphics.Rect rect)
        Draw a sprite from a spritesheet.
        Parameters:
        sprite - Sprite to be drawn on the canvas
        rect - Target rectangle for bitmap drawing

      • drawTexture

        void drawTexture(int index,
                 android.graphics.Rect rect)
        Draw a stored texture.
        Parameters:
        index - Texture index
        rect - Target rectangle for bitmap drawing

      • unloadTextures

        void unloadTextures()
        Remove all textures from memory and reset texture counter.
